intro: Frasera albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin frasera, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Frasera albomarginata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
